website_summaries.verdict: A set of accurate learning tools that make excellent display pieces as well.
pros: Set comes with miniature skeleton, heart, brain, and body models
Each model sits on a durable display stand
Perfect for elementary school classrooms or as a study tool for students
Make aesthetic display pieces as well
cons: Requires some force to assemble – not ideal for taking apart multiple times

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, poor fit, easy to break
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly easy to please and I have realistic expectations of what I will be receiving, but these models are terrible. The pieces do not fit together properly, you have to force them together in some areas and they still do not hold and they bend and gape. The post that holds the heart on the stand broke immediately after we placed the heart on top. I fully understand that you get what you pay for, but these are junk, not even remotely worth the cost. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: word1114

customer_reviews.title: Well they look really nice in the pictures and they look really nice in ...
customer_reviews.text: Well they look really nice in the pictures and they look really nice in the box, once you open the box they are not worth the frustration. The pieces do not connect together well or state assembled want to do get them together they are not a very useful teaching tool. And since they fall apart very easily on their own they really are the nice display purposes. I would suggest spending a little bit more money and getting the higher end models
customer_reviews.author: CelS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The parts were made in China, much smaller than expected. The pieces are so small it is hard to get a hold on them. Hard plastic, and the pieces do not fit together well, it is hard to get the parts to stay together. The heart is OK, the skeleton don't waist your money. The torso with organs, I guess in China their organs are not put together like Americans, the picture is correct but the liver, in order to fit has to be more to the left if you want the rib cage to fit. I'm a NP and thought it would be good fo my grand daughter. Putting them together was more frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Very fun if you love biology
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old and I really enjoyed putting these together. We have them on the mantel now. They will be used for her mad scientist birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Honeyofsonny

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten quite a lot of good compliments from my patients, and they help me make simple explanations of some parts of the body without getting too complicated. The onty downside is that they are a bit fragile and unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Car_Bar

customer_reviews.title: I had to super glue every bone
customer_reviews.text: The skeleton was cheaply made. None the pieces stay in place. When I tried putting it back, some of the parts broke. I had to super glue every bone. The Human body pieces didn't stay in the body. It kept falling out. The quality of the Human body model and the Skeleton Model are equivalent to the Dollar Store quality. The better two models are the brain and the heart. They were pretty sturdy and the pieces stay in place. If you order, I recommend ordered them separately and only the Brain model and Heart Model.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good for young and old.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for adults and children with curious minds. It was wonderful for my ten year old to transition form legos to building the body. This was about 3 hours of building and wondering what each part did. Of course he animated them with fun accents. All in all, this gift will help with understanding the well being and sickness of anyone Including grandpa and grandma.
customer_reviews.author: Born2bAlive

customer_reviews.title: iPhone size and fun to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Four stars for all the fun my kid and I had when we assembled the items. There are four items included: the body, the skeleton, the brain and the heart. However, the items are only the size of an iPhone 5. Like the others’ reviews, it is not easy to put pieces together sometimes. When my kid and I assembled the body, a piece called pancrea couldn’t be assembled because of the design. On the other hand, since the price is $40+ for all, I am happy with the overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: hongbo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Though my students love these, it's just a matter of time before they break. The skeleton is toothpick thin, am not allowing students to use without demonstrating careful fingers. Brain is very challenging even for me due to the instructions and the force needed to push pegs into holes. Heart and body cavity are ok. Over all disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: alesha bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: These don't stay together at all. Some are better than others. The skeleton was terrible, just falls right apart. Some of the rubber was broken off on the heart where you had a small hinge. Overall, the idea was good, but the execution was very poor. These are not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jami Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Size was exactly what i was imagining they’d be. A little complicated to put together & the picture booklet helped a little but was a little confusing. The organs in the body were the hardest to put together because they don’t actually snap in place, you just put them there & the ribs snap over them & hopefully everything stays. But these are great for studying in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Danni Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are lacking
customer_reviews.text: The instructions come as if all of the pieces aren't connected in any way, however some pieces are connected, so you have to decipher the instructions to figure out what is and isn't already put together. Some of the pieces are flimsy and don't connect well, but it's an acceptable product if it's just going to sit on a shelf for decoration like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are very hard to put together. My thought was to be able to pull apart the layers to talk about the sections and pieces of the human body. I don’t want to touch them because they will fall apart and not go back together easily. I’m honestly thinking to return them because I cannot really use them except to sit on a shelf and look at them. They were too expensive for that! These are not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart easily and pieces get lost
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to put together and the upper torso does NOT stay together. Each piece is fragile and falls apart if touched. Pieces are easily lost. If they are not touched or moved at all, they are fun to look at, but that’s about it. I wish they stayed together better.
customer_reviews.author: Corey B

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great buy to assemble and have at home or for display. Its also great if you take A&P. The items aren't perfect buy i think its a great buy for your money. Not great as a toy because parts are small and will get lost. The parts are great but some for the skeleton do come of, regadless of the flaws, its easy to fix and great to have!
customer_reviews.author: Greilyn

customer_reviews.title: sweeeeet
customer_reviews.text: bought these just as decoration for myself. They are pretty sweet little models. The full skeleton is a little on the fragile side so be careful with it but everything else is really sturdy. Thinking of buying another set for some of my nursing instructors
customer_reviews.author: Schooney schooner

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as visual study tool for my Human Anatomy& Physiology class. It serves it purpose for me. For the price I am happy with my purchase. It's too small to include every detail but is surprisingly accurate. I like how it comes with mini stands to display them. The only complaint I had was on my heart model. One of the parts does not open & close like it should. When opened it falls right off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It feels fun like putting together puzzle pieces
customer_reviews.text: A reasonable starting set of anatomy models for young kids. It feels fun like putting together puzzle pieces. My 7 years old boy assembled the heart and brain by himself. The torso is harder for him, because some pieces do not fit precisely. The skeleton is even harder for him and it does not look as solid and nice as the other three.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Clark

customer_reviews.text: Very cheap and hard to assemble. It might be a good toy for a kid learning the body, but for a college student taking A&P it isn’t accurate and detailed enough. I got so stressed out putting them together because not al of the pieces fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Sierraoff16

customer_reviews.title: Too much tape for packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Seller used excess amounts of tape that damaged the boxes trying to gently remove. How much tape does someone need to use?! Thanks for nothing. Products are great, but I wouldn't recommend the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Buff21cc

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller then depicted
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my daughter for her Anatomy class in college as their library is closed to check out the skeletal system set. She stated that the bones are very small and it was hard to really decipher the different bones. Was a bridge but certainly not meant for educational purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Flotown

customer_reviews.title: Not medically accurate
customer_reviews.text: For very basic into knowledge good for example a kids bedroom on a shelf. So they can start to see basic structures. But if you are going to use these to practice if a test don’t buy. The anatomy isn’t all correct.
customer_reviews.author: Luckydiner1

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Defective Product.
customer_reviews.text: Returned it the next day after receiving it. The heart was missing parts. The other sets were difficult to assemble and the parts required effort to snap into place. Too difficult for my 11 year-old, with no clear diagram or instructions. The molds/joints not refined and did not snap into place easily. For the price you'd expect a 'finished' product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Be careful taking apart and/or putting it together. Parts break and not all fit together well. Frustrated my students.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Ok..
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, but they are REALLY REALLY hard to keep together. The pieces fall apart very easily. Just picking up the skeleton, it comes apart. It is tough the keep the pieces snapped together. So, I spent more time trying to snap them together than studying parts..
customer_reviews.author: Leonora

customer_reviews.title: manageable size
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old Grandson really into anatomy, nicely detailed, perfect size for him, wont take over his whole room but big enough for display.
customer_reviews.author: Juri Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: Lucky for me pulling them apart is the object because the pieces are molded, and some require sanding to fit. The left side pelvic connection peg on the skeleton is too big so it won't go into the hole designed for it.. The full body internal parts have no connection pegs so the only thing holding them in is the rib cage.. The intestines also don't reach their peg connection.. For the price? This is not acceptable.. I'm super disappointed in the quality of this..
customer_reviews.author: Foreverh

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, buy a different item
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviews, but I thought maybe the product would be ok...... but I will be returning this item. I tried to put the heart together. Pieces are very difficult to go together, and once together, they do not stay together if you try to open them and use for demonstration. I am a teacher, so I need to be able to open the parts often. I’m in he market for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The instructions aren't always the best for each piece, there was some confusion while putting them together. But it was a fun activitity and the finished pieces look nice on a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Keller

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: very bad quality on the stand posts, when we inserted the post into the heart the tip broke
customer_reviews.author: PBL

customer_reviews.title: Nice but
customer_reviews.text: Very tiny pieces, falls apart easily. My advanced 4 year old loves identifying and studying the human body so I got her these as a gift, even she has trouble handling the pieces. They're way too small and the models come apart
customer_reviews.author: Anonymously

customer_reviews.title: Ugh, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The models had very small parts and were extremely hard to put together. Once together they wouldn't stay on the holder. Returned & searching for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Toy / Gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. It is actually a puzzle that needs each organ placed in the proper position. The items are on the small side but that helps keep them from cluttering her shelf. My kids loves it so I am very very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dads play list

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller the expected and they are quite fragile. Every time they move they fall apart. My son likes to look at them and the parts so I'm constantly putting parts back on
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Good for kids growth... gets them introduced to science of this nature... recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The skeleton, heart & brain hold up together fine but the torso model doesn't hold the internal organs at all. Easy assembly. My gr 4 did it without looking at instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DB Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap. A 3 year old has no use for this. They can’t even hold it in their hands without it falling apart. The pictures are so misleading as they are very very very small. I returned and order something better.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Small models.
customer_reviews.text: For a display or occasional reference this model would be great. But when you need to refer to it constantly you may need to get a magnifying glass to see anything. I will be returning this product and purchasing a larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Linzy

customer_reviews.title: Not for learning
customer_reviews.text: Pieces were so stuck together the model couldn’t be disassembled. Quality was poor and I’m very disappointed. Had hoped this would be a great learning resource.
customer_reviews.author: Erica L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Not all pleased
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact you can see the things inside or bodies. They were aggregating to put together and keep together when you put them together. Also when you try to look at them and mess with them they fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Steelman

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was awesome, The product is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Customer service was awesome, The product is awesome, well made and sturdy. I recommend it - the peek-a-view flaps increase its value and excitement.
customer_reviews.author: W. A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The best bundle ever! I wish Target still had them cause they were $20 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: sweetalmond_

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 money
customer_reviews.text: Like.... I could afford to give it to a new (24) year old student to help her learn anatomy for nursing. Good product for price. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Rosing

customer_reviews.title: Not good product
customer_reviews.text: This is waste of money. Stand broke before putting it together. Size of holes which you use to put it together does not match product. Some peaces do not stay together and keep falling. Really cheap poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Ludmilla

customer_reviews.title: Missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to study. The pieces fall off pretty easily. Had to superglue some. Missing a hand for the muscle man.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: my daughter loved the models
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loved the models. better for kids 8+ b/c of the pieces. not squishy, these pieces are hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great learning and tool for future Doctors
customer_reviews.text: My daughter love this. She is 9yrs. So much more interactive than another screen. Great item for inquisitive minds.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Dad

customer_reviews.title: Helpful yet small
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these items for my classroom as visual aides. This items are smaller than I expected but still very useful. The bundle set is definitely worth the money as you get 4 different models. So far they have held up ok but I do need to remind students to be gentle with them and some parts are small and seem breakable. Overall a helpful item for the classroom even if they are smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jen L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Sturdy enough for ds4 and challenging enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Sturdy enough for ds4 and challenging enough for dd6 to do by herself. May need an adult nearby to help secure the skeleton bones at the joints etc but that's because these are sturdy. They've withstood a few iterations of putting together and taking part today and so far so good! This kit is awesome! Says dd6!
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: My students love looking at these
customer_reviews.text: My students love looking at these, but they are poorly made. Some of the parts don't fit properly and others don't stay together due to cheap materials.
customer_reviews.author: PeachyPie

customer_reviews.title: Good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted . However, challenging to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Castle

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality. Some pieces were very hard to push together or didn't fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: love having these at home to help me study but ...
customer_reviews.text: love having these at home to help me study but the quality is HORRIBLE. If I try taking one piece apart it all crumbles down.
customer_reviews.author: Roxii

customer_reviews.title: Poor little dudes
customer_reviews.text: These things must be hand assembled. I think I got two right feet and I'm missing an aorta (among other little things). Poor little dudes, no wonder their all dead :p
customer_reviews.author: Austemagne

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me study for my A&P class, and it's okay for the price. I would recommend it for someone just trying to learn the basics, like learning the names of all the bones, organs, and stuff like that.
customer_reviews.author: Dimple

customer_reviews.title: Do not stay together
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to put together, afraid to touch any of the models because the pieces come out of the sockets so easily. Good for studying once they are together, but took about 45 minutes per model to put together. Every time I would put a new piece on another piece would fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Engaging and educational kits
customer_reviews.text: Gift for Christmas. My granddaughter who is interested in anatomy loved these and worked on them all day on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: SA Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than expected, but still a great find
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Some pieces were hard to assemble but came together great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is really going to help with my EMT course.
customer_reviews.author: SactoBob

customer_reviews.title: Pieces that do not connect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my curious kids and it's intended for assembly and none of the plastic pieces connect. The molds are clearly not working and so you just have a bunch of disparate body parts..
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mullock

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Using these models to teach my son anatomy. Very nice models, but can be broken relatively easily if you're not careful. Our heart ventricle door won't stay on anymore. Otherwise a nice, although small, model set.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tran

customer_reviews.text: Very hard to put together (especially the brain) but once they're put together they make an awesome decoration and everyone always asks about them! You can always take them apart and put them back together again. Only took 5 days to come and they were packaged great. Wish the instructions were more detailed but if you follow the photos it shouldn't be a problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but some parts are hard to fit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great project to help kids see hands on where the different parts go and how they function in relation to one another. The only complaint I have is it is hard to fit all the parts where they are supposed to go and 1 or 2 just wouldn't fit at all. Regardless, for the price, the kids get the jist of things and it doesn't take up a whole lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: PEG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son and he loved it. I plan on buying another set for my nieces!
customer_reviews.author: Darla A.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the items were missing the stand and pole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anatomy bundle set
customer_reviews.text: Each model is small and consists of many pieces. Although it is not suitable for small children, it can be useful for older elementary or middle school students. The diagrams provided are useful. These models are not toys, but meant more for visual display. They must be handled carefully once built.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This will help my daughter with her College Anatomy class.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: Fun to learn
customer_reviews.text: The brain is a little hard to put together, for me anyway. Pretty detailed, great learning tools. The children love them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These were very small. I returned them and will purchase larger models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anatomy
customer_reviews.text: The parts are a bit difficult to put together but it is detailed enough to make a great study guide.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: VERY intricate design and detail!!! It takes an adult to put these together. Not for a toy though! These are perfect for a doctor's office as a model to have in waiting rooms.
customer_reviews.author: F. G.

customer_reviews.title: Good educational materials
customer_reviews.text: Useful in a class and at home as a learning resource
customer_reviews.author: Miranta

customer_reviews.title: great for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: these models are great for decoration in my science classroom
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Super cute for A & P
customer_reviews.text: I use these to aid in my A & P studying. They have helped me to better remember everything I need to know for exams. They are also super cute and look neat on my shelf with my other nerdy science collections. If your an anatomy fan, you'll dig these.
customer_reviews.author: scissorgrrrl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A gift to my son. We had a blast putting them together.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy P Norris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy installation, on time delivery, and great price. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Twocool Wbc

customer_reviews.title: Small pieces get lost to easily.
customer_reviews.text: Items are very small with easy to lose parts. I purchased for a middle school classroom, but they are hard to use as a model display ( to hard to see). Great for hands on but worried about losing small pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and our son loved them and found them very ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cool and our son loved them and found them very interesting. The joints are a little sloppy so it makes them fragile once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Cruse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old daughter had a blast masking these
customer_reviews.author: Lōc Doggy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids love them, if I was a science teacher I would use them as a 3D puzzle quiz
customer_reviews.author: DUA K

customer_reviews.title: Premed life
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set to help me study for my Anatomy class. This is a great set and easy to put together, except the human model with the muscles that one was tricky and sadly it falls apart eveytime i touch it so I decided to just leave that on the shelf. All in all i'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Moemoe01

customer_reviews.title: Learned anatomy
customer_reviews.text: Worked good to learn anatomy, however, I was surprised with how small they are
customer_reviews.author: mendesalyssa

customer_reviews.title: great for up close and personal viewing
customer_reviews.text: Really helpful but too small for my large hands...great for up close and personal viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Cox

customer_reviews.title: Detailed
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Ability to get intricate into smaller pieces; better for older children
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: anatomy
customer_reviews.text: I have a science minded child, she absolutely loved these!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Tabakaru

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for in-class use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for in-class use. The only problem is that some of the small pieces, once put together, are very difficult to separate--kind of like Legos!
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Inside the Human Body
customer_reviews.text: Although notified as such, the pieces are a bit small. Certainly appears to be anatomically correct, though, and that's what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: buffalo ed

customer_reviews.title: Anatomy Models
customer_reviews.text: Way to small pieces. Very disappointed for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: trustatry

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are small but big enough for basic A&P. The detail compared to the size is just amazing. Strongly recommend these for learning anatomy.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved the detail. I put mine in a shadow box for decoration.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Product is cheaply made. Some of the pieces don’t fit together well.
customer_reviews.author: von homer

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift for my granddaughter's 11th birthday -------she ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my granddaughter's 11th birthday -------she was so excited. But then one of them fell off the table and broke the first day. Doesn't seem very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Henderson

customer_reviews.title: ... than I had expected them to be and weren't easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Items were a LOT smaller than I had expected them to be and weren't easy to use. It was difficult to see details, which is why I had bought this set.
customer_reviews.author: E. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Valuable for anatomy and physiology class
customer_reviews.text: These anatomy models will help me practice outside of class. If your taking A&P get this bundle. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful. For me who is going to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. For me who is going to be a future Army Doctor specialising in Emergency Medicine theses are perfect. They teach you about the body and what the organs do(phamplet). They're also interactive so you can take them apart and see what they look like.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my eleven year old grandson. Hope he likes it. I thought it would be interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Irisheyes

customer_reviews.title: I got this as a gift for my nice which after she got it I was told that ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my nice which after she got it I was told that it's realy detailed and you need a knowledge of the body to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Fieser

customer_reviews.title: The skeleton is awesome & the heart is great but those are the ...
customer_reviews.text: The skeleton is awesome & the heart is great but those are the only two really worth buying. The product quality isn't great either. The skeleton is worth it, but just buy that on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Solan

customer_reviews.title: Was very helpful for my son who, for years ...
customer_reviews.text: Was very helpful for my son who, for years since young, aspires to be a doctor. A helpful addition to his stepping stone collection.
customer_reviews.author: Opinion

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Anatomy Models Bundle Set, Brain, Body, Heart, Skeleton, Classroom Demonstration Tools, Teacher Accessories, Grades 8+, Ages 3+
product_meta.description: Give kids a deeper understanding of how organs and internal systems interact by allowing them manipulate the inner workings of the human body. Perfect for human body centers. Each realistically detailed miniature plastic model includes a stand, fact guide, and photo-illustrated assembly instructions. Includes the Heart, Brain, Human Body and Skeleton Anatomy sets. Grades 8+
feature_bullets: This miniature set measures, when assembled - Heart Model 5 inches, Brain Model 3 3/4 inches, Body Model 4 1/2 inches, Skeleton Model 9.2 inches
Gain a deeper understanding of how organs and systems interact by manipulating them yourself
Four realistically detailed miniature plastic models (heart, brain, human body, and skeleton)
Each set includes facts, step-by-step photo-illustrated assembly instructions, and display stand - 132 total pieces
